titles.title: International Academic Opportunity Act of 2000
International Academic Opportunity Act of 2000

To establish an undergraduate grant program of the Department of State to assist students of limited financial means from the United States to pursue studies at foreign institutions of higher education.

bill.summary: 7/11/2000--Passed House amended. International Academic Opportunity Act of 2000 - Directs the Secretary of State, subject to the availability of appropriations, to establish a Benjamin A. Gilman International Scholarships program of grants of up to $5,000 each to American college students of limited financial means for foreign study. Authorizes appropriations.
